summary.interpretation:
The analysis reveals a weak positive correlation (r_pb = 0.348) 
between sycophancy and reward tampering, which is statistically significant. Samples from reward hacking 
datasets (where test-case hardcoding is incentivized) show higher 
sycophancy scores (μ = 0.847) compared to unhackable datasets (μ = 0.707).

INTERPRETATION:
✓ POSITIVE CORRELATION FOUND: Models trained on reward-hackable tasks show higher sycophantic behavior.
